title: CYC: A Large-scale Investment in Knowledge Infrastructure

abstract_or_summary: This paper presents CYC, a large-scale investment in knowledge infrastructure.

title: DBpedia - A Crystalization Point for the Web of Data
source_name: Web Semantics: Science, Services and Agents on the World Wide Web
abstract_or_summary: This paper presents DBpedia, a project that extracts structured information from Wikipedia and makes it available on the Web. DBpedia is a semantic markup of Wikipedia, which allows for easier querying and integration with other data sources.

title: DBpedia: A Nucleus for a Web of Open Data
source_name: The Semantic Web

title: Yago: A Core of Semantic Knowledge
source_name: Proceedings of the 16th International Conference on World Wide Web

title: Yago: A Large Ontology from Wikipedia and WordNet
source_name: Web Semantics: Science, Services and Agents on the World Wide Web
abstract_or_summary: This paper presents Yago, a large ontology derived from Wikipedia and WordNet. Yago combines the structured information from Wikipedia with the semantic relations from WordNet to create a rich and detailed ontology for the Web.

title: Why Linked Data is Not Enough for Scientists
source_name: Future Generation Computer Systems
abstract_or_summary: This paper discusses the limitations of Linked Data in addressing the needs of scientists, highlighting the importance of more comprehensive data models and integration strategies.

source_name: Communications of the ACM

title: Factoring Yago: Scalable Machine Learning for Linked Data

name: Probase: A Probabilistic Taxonomy for Text Understanding
definition: This paper presents Probase, a probabilistic taxonomy for text understanding. Probase: A Probabilistic Taxonomy for Text Understanding is a research paper that introduces a probabilistic taxonomy for text understanding. The paper presents a method for learning a hierarchical taxonomy of concepts from text, which can be used for tasks such as information retrieval and natural language processing.
aliases: A Probabilistic Taxonomy for Text Understanding
vendor_or_originator: ACM SIGMOD International Conference on Management of Data

title: Coupled Semi-supervised Learning for Information Extraction
source_name: Proceedings of the Third ACM International Conference on Web Search and Data Mining

title: Open Question Answering with Weakly Supervised Embedding Models
source_name: Joint European Conference on Machine Learning and Knowledge Discovery in Databases
abstract_or_summary: This paper presents a method for open question answering using weakly supervised embedding models. The approach leverages the power of embedding models to learn representations of concepts and entities, which can then be used to answer open-domain questions.

title: Linked Data - The Story So Far
source_name: International Journal on Semantic Web and Information Systems
abstract_or_summary: This paper presents a historical overview of the Linked Data movement, tracing its development from its origins in the late 1990s to the present day. It discusses the key concepts, technologies, and standards that have shaped the field, as well as the challenges and opportunities that remain.

source_name: Proceedings of the 42nd Association for Computational Linguistics
abstract_or_summary: This paper presents a method for extracting relations by combining lexical, syntactic, and semantic features using maximum entropy models.

title: Implementation of a kernel-based Chinese relation extraction system
source_name: Journal of Computer Research and Development
abstract_or_summary: This paper presents the implementation of a kernel-based Chinese relation extraction system. The system is designed to automatically extract relationships from Chinese text. The implementation details and experimental results are discussed, demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed method in Chinese relation extraction tasks.

title: Building, maintaining, and using knowledge bases: A report from the trenches
source_name: Proceedings of the 32nd ACM SIGMOD Int Conf on Management of Data
abstract_or_summary: This paper presents a report on the challenges and practices involved in building, maintaining, and using knowledge bases. The authors discuss the various aspects of knowledge base development, including data integration, query processing, and system maintenance. The report provides insights into the practical issues faced in real-world scenarios and highlights the importance of effective knowledge management in data management systems.

title: A phrase mining framework for recursive construction of a topical hierarchy
source_name: ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining
abstract_or_summary: This paper presents a phrase mining framework for recursive construction of a topical hierarchy. The framework is designed to efficiently extract and organize phrases from large text corpora, enabling the creation of hierarchical topic structures that can be used for information retrieval and data mining tasks.

title: Knowledge base inference and maintenance system
source_name: Journal of National University of Defense Technology
abstract_or_summary: This paper presents a knowledge base inference and maintenance system (KBIMS) that is designed to handle the tasks of knowledge base inference and maintenance. The system is implemented and tested, demonstrating its effectiveness in managing knowledge bases.

title: XLore: A Large-scale English-Chinese Bilingual Knowledge Graph
source_name: Proceedings of the 12th International Semantic Web Conference
abstract_or_summary: XLore is a large-scale English-Chinese bilingual knowledge graph that aims to bridge the gap between English and Chinese knowledge resources. It is constructed by aligning English and Chinese knowledge entities and relations, and it serves as a foundation for multilingual knowledge graph applications.
